content.description: Fun little traversy climb on diagonal holds. Start wherever seems natural; there could also be a sit start farther down right perhaps. Grade is speculative.
content.location: Downstream-facing (north) side of the River Spot boulders, to the left of Stevie and slightly uphill.

content.description: An excellent overhung boulder with a lot of diverse moves. Start sitting under the triangle-shape feature with right hand on arete and left in the blocky undercling. Kneebar your way out and up to the squeezy holds and a nice topout.
content.location: Along the trail down in the River Spot, can't miss it

content.description: On the right side of the little cave (across from Carrot) you'll find a heinously hard, short boulder that may or may have not been done yet. Start sitting with feet way under the boulder and hands in a slopey undercling. Pull up hard to a decent edge, then crank up to the lip. Short, steep, terribly hard.
content.location: Right side of the small cave down in the River Spot, right off the trail

content.description: An excellent, stout climb coming out of the little cave. Start with left hand in the slot and right hand low on a sidepull block, and make big powerful moves out to the lip, then delicately position yourself for the topout without dabbing the boulder behind you. Feels like something they'd set in the gym.
content.location: Along the trail down in the River Spot, can't miss this little cave

content.description: A cool downhill spot closer to the river, with a few really high quality climbs.
